search_results.snippet: The Order of Leopold II is an order of Belgium and is named in honor of King Lopold II. The decoration was established on 24 August 1900 by Leopold II as king of the Congo Free State and was in 1908, upon Congo being handed over to Belgium, incorporated into the Belgian awards system.
